intro: Tersonia subvolubilis, commonly known as the creeping tersonia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its trailing growth habit and produces small, pale pink to white flowers. The plant has heart-shaped leaves with a soft, velvety texture. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Tersonia subvolubilis is often used in ornamental gardening for its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
